section.text: *NOTE: This section was created by temporary legislation that will expire on November 29, 2025.*
section.heading: Throwing projectiles at residential property.

para.text: It is unlawful for any person to launch or throw a projectile onto the residential property of another with the intent to cause fear, intimidate, or retaliate against any person living or working at that residence.
A person who violates this section, upon conviction, shall be fined no more than the amount set forth in § 22-3571.01, or incarcerated for no more than 90 days, or both.

annotations.annotation: For temporary (90 days) creation of this section, see § 2(c) of Residential Tranquility Emergency Amendment Act of 2024 (D.C. Act 25-622, Nov. 4, 2024, 71 DCR 13558).
For temporary (90 days) creation of this section, see § 2(c) of Residential Tranquility Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2025 (D.C. Act 26-2, Jan. 31, 2025, 72 DCR 1130).
For temporary (225 days) creation of this section, see § 2(c) of Residential Tranquility Temporary Amendment Act of 2024 (D.C. Law 25-323, Apr. 18, 2025, 71 DCR 14480).
For temporary (90 days) creation of this section, see § 2(c) of Residential Tranquility Second Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2025 (D.C. Act 26-55, Apr. 22, 2025, 0 DCR 0).
